alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Bertie, southeastern Northampton, Gates, northwestern Chowan, northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, northwestern Perquimans, Hertford, southwestern Isle of Wight, and southeastern Southampton Counties, the southwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Franklin and the southern City of Suffolk through 930 PM EDT... At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to near Murfreesboro to 8 miles west of Rich Square. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Ahoskie, Windsor, Murfreesboro, Rich Square, Aulander, Gatesville, Ryland, Sunbury, Holland, Chowan University, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Gates, Conway, Woodland, Winton, Lewiston Woodville, Cofield and Powellsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk
